website_summaries.verdict: At $199, the Asus MeMO Pad ME181C is a capable, affordable 8-inch Android tablet.

customer_reviews.title: Asus keeps improving.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these tablets for 3 of my friends and they all love them. I have an older MeMo Pad and I'm very happy with it too. The ME181C is very responsive, has a decent screen resolution and the manufacturer skin of Android is not overwhelming at all. As for battery life my friends tell me that with some lite use (1-2 hours a day) the tablet can last a few days with 1 charge which is good. The camera is not stellar or anything but that's not a big deal for a tablet. This is an amazing tablet for the price and I'm very glad that Asus is making very good improvements to their tablet lineup.
customer_reviews.author: otaku64

customer_reviews.title: My New Daily-Use Tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty decent tablet with one caveat: you must upgrade to at least firmware version WW-3.1.23.172 .. Otherwise your battery will drain itself on standby over night. Once you upgrade to WW-3.1.23.172+ your battery will hold a charge like it's supposed to. I went a little further than this by limiting the maximum CPU frequency. Unfortunately, the minimum frequency of this Intel CPU is 532 MHz. It's also easy to root and some of the built-in Asus apps are not bad. I currently use the Asus Browser and Asus Camera as my defaults.
customer_reviews.author: Sosumido

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this tablet
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tablet for about four months now and it is wonderful, especially for the price. I previously had a 2012 version of Nexus 7, which I liked but passed on to my husband. This is very similar to my old Nexus, since they are both made my ASUS, but this one is faster and somewhat bigger, but thin and light. I've received at least 3 "system updates" from ASUS since my purchase, each one an improvement to the prior system. The resolution of the screen is wonderful for my purposes. I have a 32GB microSD in the slot and I can't imagine needing more storage at this point.
customer_reviews.author: B. MOONEY

customer_reviews.title: Not A Fast Tablet
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a tablet to handle my social media ( Twitter, Facebook) that didn't have lag time. I have high speed internet at home at thought this would be a great choice. Unfortunately the tablet ultimately disappointed me as there was serious lag time using the apps to post to social media. The fit and finish on this are very good to excellent. Very easy to hold. For others this maybe a good tablet. But I need one with a faster processor.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Bill

customer_reviews.title: Good: -Comparatively inexpensive -Has much of the functionality sought ...
customer_reviews.text: Note: I am a biased user because my primary tablet is an iPad. This tablet was purchased as a testing platform for some experiments. Good: -Comparatively inexpensive -Has much of the functionality sought in a tablet -Holds a reasonable charge Bad: -Noticeably lower performance, especially with browsing speed and media -Stability issues are very noticeable. Considering Android is running on a much wider range of tablets than iOS, this is not surprising. Final thoughts: This is a good 'disposable' tablet for experimenting with different ideas, but if you tend to push the limits of your tablet and need something to serve as a workhorse, this isn't it.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. Screen resolution and brightness are as good ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on Amazon Sale event. Excellent product. Screen resolution and brightness are as good as any super expensive tablets. Today I inserted a fully loaded 64GB micro SD card and this tablet could read all the media files. Tried it as a GPS navigation device - worked flawlessly. Yes, it has an in-built GPS. Works well with Chromecast. It's a great tablet.
customer_reviews.author: AOS

customer_reviews.title: Great for casual use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this used, as it was an affordable alternative to the new Zenbook. I had also considered the new $49 Amazon Kindle, but I really wanted an 8" tablet rather than the 7". Even with a used unit, I'm getting battery life and performance on par with my girlfriend's computer! I'm using it for very light/casual gaming and web browsing, and for these purposes, it's a breeze. The interface is very snappy and responsive, and the build quality feels really solid. For under $100, I'm not sure how much better it gets than this.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel

customer_reviews.title: A great tablet for vacations.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to take on trips for our kids to watch their videos, we especially love the micro-sd card slot so we can easily and cheaply put dozens of movies on this. We have used it in the car and in many hotel rooms, it is great. The interface is speedy and it has a processor that can easily handle hi-def video. The Android OS has been updated a couple of times as well. I am not a "tablet guy" but playing with this I can see what all the fuss is about.
customer_reviews.author: Crossfit Dadoh

customer_reviews.title: Great looking tablet, excellent value for this spec winner
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is an excellent choice. I compared several models, and this ASUS MeMO Pad 8 wins the spec comparison easily over all other models in the $100-$200 range. It was a gift for my daughter, so I really loved that we could select her favorite color (purple), and it has performed perfectly since we got it a month ago. The display is really brilliant and and it even has decent sound, although it's usually used with headphones (not included). Very fast and smooth operation, and we like that has 16GB flash memory plus expandable through SD slot. Easy to setup, and plenty of case options for this model.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Molter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Tablet!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first tablet purchase and I've enjoyed everything about it. Sound quality is great. Easy to use. Loved the selection of color options. Had a problem with it about the 10th month of owning it and the included 1 year warranty covered everything except the shipping cost to them. They fixed it and shipped it back for free. No problems since. Will definitely be sticking with this manufacturer when it's time to upgrade. The picture quality is amazing, better than my husband's tablet. I could go on and on about everything I like. For the price I paid, I think it was an amazing deal. Thanks ASUS!
customer_reviews.author: Noilemahc

customer_reviews.title: Asus makes a good reasonably priced unit.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a techie so I cannot report on that but what I can say is that I am a great-gramma and this is easy for me to use. A couple of my friends who have well off boomer kids got Ipads as gifts. Mostly they are confused by all the bells and whistles. But this is not to say that this unit lacks what I needed or wanted. It fills the bill. Only problem is I am kinda hooked on it especially for ebooks from my library and emails snd in surfing the web..well you get the picture. The larger screen is good and holds a charge well. And the price...you can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent value for anyone who does not have enough money ...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent value for anyone who does not have enough money for an iPad. The 16 GB of internal memory is large enough to hold many of my favorite apps without having to try to adjust for space limitations (my smartphone only has 2 GB!). The screen is very vivid and lifelike, and the quality of HD videos puts even my desktop computer to shame. I sometimes have to reboot it when playing Candy Crush, but in my experience it is an issue with the app itself (I have had occasional problems with it even on my 4th gen iPod touch)
customer_reviews.author: Scott Long

customer_reviews.title: MeMO Please!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for the price,lite and fast. The built quality is great for this size tablet.It has a Intel chip which is my first on a Android device and I think it's nice. Some have said they had trouble with some app working with the Intel chip,not for me. All the big apps work well Netflix,Facebook and all the Google ones and more had no problems. I could have done without most of the Asus apps but the audio and camera ones are great .The disappointment is no AC or 5g WIFI support but the 2.43 WIFI is fast works well. If you are looking for a nice small tablet,you can't go wrong with this one at this price(IMOP).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's really good for the price
customer_reviews.text: It's really good for the price. It's got a decently nice display, the battery life is awesome, the touch response is good, the processor is good, all in all it's a really good tablet if it's your first, or if you need to do basic things like email, internet surfing, IMing, etc. There's a camera on the back, which is decent for the price, and a front camera, which is real fuzzy. I bought this tablet to use for basic items, and for the battery life. It's a good buy for anyone who hasn't ever had a tablet and doesn't need to do anything excessive on it. It's also good to watch movies on, even in HD.
customer_reviews.author: MacDaddy_Pro

customer_reviews.title: It was rated good for a tablet under $200 & is not too ...
customer_reviews.text: After reading multiple reviews I decided to go wish this brand tablet for my 7yo. son. It was rated good for a tablet under $200 & is not too small to strain his eyes nor too big ,bulky & expensive like an iPad. I found a case for it on Amazon as well but need to exchange it for a darker color as white will show everything. Also I will not that even though it is Wi-Fi only I have found games on the play store that don't need Wi-Fi to work so it should work great when traveling, etc. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Tablet for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what my Girlfriend was looking for. She just wanted something she could get online with and play some games on, And this fit the bill perfectly. This by no means will replace your computer, But for $150 who in their right mind would expect it to? The screen is nice and clear, It is decently fast, Have not found a game yet that it will not play, It's not heavy and it does not get hot either. We ordered the Purple version and it is a nice darker color purple, Not too dark but not bright either. All in all a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Wickline

customer_reviews.title: Love this tablet
customer_reviews.text: The tablet is great so far. The main reason I got it was to occasionally watch video with XBMC aka Kodi, stream from my network, casual game play and as a reader. It does all the above perfectly. The screen is bright and vibrate. The cameras are not great but as others have stated most of these tablets cams aren't the best. No issues with setting up the wifi or dropped connections so far. For casual use I'm satisfied with the battery usage.
customer_reviews.author: david610

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware of Blue!
customer_reviews.text: The worst tablet ever. My poor son has purchased two of these and both of them have been defective. He used his birthday money and has been so upset and disappointed with his purchase. I am hoping that Asus will do right by him being the second tablet was purchased just about a month ago and was brand new in the box. Maybe he needs to pick a different color!
customer_reviews.author: Nightmare68

customer_reviews.title: the display is beautiful, the battery life is excellent
customer_reviews.text: Does everything I ask of it. The interface is sleek, the display is beautiful, the battery life is excellent, and it's decently snappy. My only qualm is that it comes with a LOT of Asus bloatware. Some are required for the interface, but most are redundant programs that you'd probably never use over their native Android counterparts.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Williams

customer_reviews.title: The first unit had a bad keyboard but Amazon immediately replaced it (two days) and ...
customer_reviews.text: The first unit had a bad keyboard but Amazon immediately replaced it (two days) and paid for return of the first unit. Had fire for yrs., but too many limits on fire as to what & where you can download even if you sideload. Wanted larger screen and this 8" screen is perfect, along with quadcore processor. Learning the unit is not unlike most electronics that require a learning curve to enjoy the units full potential.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Cadwallader

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love?
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little tablet! It makes me wonder how much I'm actually going to use my new iPad air 2 or my Kindle paperwhite. The MeMO is light weight and thin. The browser is lightening fast. The display is crisp and clear. It's the perfect size to throw into a purse. I'm thinking it's going to be my go-to device for quick look-ups and for reading in bed. If my outlook changes, I'll do another update.
customer_reviews.author: Virginian

customer_reviews.title: Fun while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: I liked the tablet while it worked. I bought it in late July, arrived around the first of Aug and have used it to check email and facebook about once or twice daily. Last night it would not turn back on. I tired charging and that did not work. The return period has expired from the seller that I bought it from here on Amazon. I will try a different brand next time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: works great no problems
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for 6 months and I have had no problems at all I put a cover on it a rubber bumper cover and I don't bang around a lot too but I do take it on the road I have no no problems at all I think you would have a good luck with it decent quality merchandise I hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Hauser

customer_reviews.title: Fair price, accurate description, fast delivery-- what more could one want?
customer_reviews.text: I bought two tablets at about the same time-- this one and a no-name-brand cheapo. BIG difference as to the speed of the processor, the reliability and ease of the touch screen, and the overall feel. I like it! I use it mostly for streaming videos from my TiVo, to watch in my computer room as I surf the web, while I use the cheapo for checking email while I watch TV in the living room. I wish I had two of these, instead.
customer_reviews.author: Bobbi P

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2, love the size, the speed of this tablet, and the weight - very light. Both my husband and myself have one now and its a lovely little device - would prefer the volume buttons to be on the other side of the device, as it is hard to find them AND difficult to discern between them and the power button as they are all approximately the same size. Great little budget-tech device, does what I want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot in the Meadow

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily to be used as an e-reader. The screen is big and bright, and words are easy to read. This pairs easily with bluetooth earbuds to let me listen to music and read a a book while on the treadmill. Apps run quickly and web browsing is smooth. This is my fourth Asus tablet and I have not had problems with any of them. This might be the best Asus tablet that I have bought.
customer_reviews.author: HobbesEsq

customer_reviews.title: great Android tabled running Intel Atom
customer_reviews.text: This is great Android tablet running Intel Atom processor. All apps I needed work fine. WIFI, audio, screen all work great. Although my tablet screen happened to have a bluish shadow on dark screens so I had to send it back to ASUS for repair (Amazon seller wouldn't exchange it..? ). ASUS handled it very well and I got it back working as expected. Great job ASUS!!!
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet. Great Price. For now.
customer_reviews.text: One of the great tablets available for the price without buying a nexus 7, in my opinion..!! For me personally, I like this one better. However, with that said, I am still waiting for their 'hopped up' tablet that can receive phone calls and is an even better tablet than this one. It's called the ME581CL. (It's exactly the same size too..!!) Should be available by Fall of 2014. Look for it.
customer_reviews.author: Pcprntr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent budget tablet
customer_reviews.text: Nice tablet, I own the 7" Memopad and this is a step up even from those which were a great buy. Also, very easily rooted without yes without access to a computer. Unfotunately not alot of development for it in that aspect (clockwork mod, cyanogen,etc etc) as of yet but no problem whatsoever simply rooting.
customer_reviews.author: Joe L

customer_reviews.title: Worth EVERY penny!!
customer_reviews.text: This little table it AWESOME! It's fast, super cool ti use and runs all the apps I love. I really like the "Play To" feature and it's ability to send it's content to my Smart TV. And while I never planned to use it all that much I was also VERY impressed with the camera's "depth of field effect".
customer_reviews.author: DGreco63

customer_reviews.title: Best thing I have ever bought
customer_reviews.text: This is literally the best thing I have ever bought. I was unsure about switching from Apple's products at first but this has made me an android user. It's fast, the perfect size, has full customization, and can even emulate old games without icky warranty-voiding jail-breaking. The only thing is it needs to be rebooted about once every other week or so, otherwise it starts getting a little slow and apps start crashing left and right. Rebooting, however, is an extraordinarily small price to pay for something that is so reliable and useful. This is just great :)
customer_reviews.author: Grace T.

customer_reviews.title: it's a pretty good product
customer_reviews.text: For the price I paid, it's a pretty good product. I don'y like taking my laptop with me onto campus, so I bring this little guy along to work on notes at the library between classes. Overall, it was a good investment for a broke college kid.
customer_reviews.author: Haley S.

customer_reviews.title: Decent as budget tablet, I recommend Zenpad 8 for double the RAM and better processor
customer_reviews.text: The tablet has a nice screen, fast processor, and just enough RAM to function. Newer APPs will often crash when the screen rotates. I have had several errors while trying to upload pictures taken with the tablet because of insufficient RAM. My biggest gripe is Asus refused to give it the Android 5.0 update. The MeMO Pad 7 got it but not the 8. I highly recommend spending the extra to get Zenpad 8 with double the RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Devin T. Brandt

customer_reviews.title: Great little tablet.  Just remember its a little tablet and not a laptop replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Great little tablet to take care of web browsing and light applications. Not sure I would use it as a laptop replacement - but it will definitely handle quite a bit. There is a bit of bloatware installed on the unit but other than that - I really like it and would consider buying it again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: Way too much bloatware that cannot be uninstalled or disabled (I suspect this is part of the reason of the poor performance). I
customer_reviews.text: Every software update seems to cause it to run slower than the last. Way too much bloatware that cannot be uninstalled or disabled (I suspect this is part of the reason of the poor performance). I rarely use this thing anymore.
customer_reviews.author: W C Genzer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tablet for the price - the colors are deep ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tablet for the price - the colors are deep and true, the form factor is perfect for most content including browsing the web, writing emails and playing some games. My wife primarily uses this tablet, but I get to borrow it from time to time and I'm always happy to do so. Combine the positives with the price of this and it's a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: A really good value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little machine. I bought mine about a month ago, but I didn't really use it much. I really like the ASUS ZenUI interface as it makes it really easy to keep track of things you need to do, and what's coming up. It held a charge pretty well too!
customer_reviews.author: turningpaige

customer_reviews.title: I am super happy with it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a digital navigation chart for sea and air to hook up to my GPS device. As a secondary mid-range tablet for the price I paid ($70), I am super happy with it. Decent screen, pretty snappy (for intended use) and nice battery life.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.M

customer_reviews.title: The Best Undroppable Tablet by ASUS!
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful! Very nice, quick, and it never clogged up. Well, it's not the best I guess but it is problem free! ...until I had to return it when it dropped to the floor. Sheesh! Couldn't even take a 3 foot fall! Good thing I had the protection plan. Still good though. Five stars. Yeah. Ha.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Belcourt

customer_reviews.title: A good fit for my needs.....
customer_reviews.text: I've had this prodct for close to a year and am very please with it's performance. Lots of apps available and a nice size for my purposes. I only use it with wifi in my house and have very quick response and downloads. No problem to stream movies on it or to surf the web. ASUS is tops in my book!
customer_reviews.author: Reid Woolery

customer_reviews.title: nice little tablet
customer_reviews.text: Nice tablet at what I thought was a reasonable price, it is my first tablet so I can't really judge if it was filled with too much blotware but does have what seem to be a few unremoveable apps that I will not use. Screen comes all the way to the side bezel so I found it hard to hold until I got a case for it.
customer_reviews.author: Grandrapidite

customer_reviews.title: Asus 8 inch 16 GB tablet.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the Asus 8 inch tablet . The only thing is after a couple of hours it has to be recharged. The sound is very nice I like to listen to music and the Asus sounds really nice through my wireless headphones. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: beebee12

customer_reviews.title: Nice tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: I received the tablet very fast but first one was defective. Amazon promptly replaced it. I own an iPad mini and I love this tablet. The size is nice and the weight is great. I'm giving it 4 stars because 1 received 1DOA, instructions have to be downloaded, and accessories are hard to find. Otherwise I would have given it 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Granny Dedee

customer_reviews.title: Best tablet I have used!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I originally bought the Amazon HD 6 and it did not live up to the standards of what I wanted to do with it. The operating system was very limited along with the app store. So I returned it and bought this. The operating system is similar to my phone and easy to use. I have a few apps that I was worried about syncing between my tablet and phone and that works great! The tablet itself is nice and lightweight (I ordered the purple one and I love the color). The size is great, it fits nicely in my purse or backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Jerrica G.

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars for the MeMo 8, 5 for the seller
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife because she thought it would be similar to her Samsung Galaxy, only bigger. The Galaxy is faster and has a clearer picture.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scott Young

customer_reviews.title: UPSIDE DOWN
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty much what I expected except I'm having a hard time keeping it "right side up". Seems like every time I move it, the screen turns 90 degrees from what I expect. Guess I just need to get used to it, right?
customer_reviews.author: R. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet it works fine it's fast because I have high-speed Internet at my house some people say it's slow that's probably because they don't have high-speed Internet battery life is Great t if you take care of it so far so good best tablet I've ever owned
customer_reviews.author: Aeonflux

customer_reviews.title: but otherwise as a tablet it's fine. Does not consistently work with Square's Contactless & ...
customer_reviews.text: The camera is a bit slow, but otherwise as a tablet it's fine. Does not consistently work with Square's Contactless & Chip card reader. I suspect that Asus's BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy) implementation is not quite there, as the reader works okay on iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: I did a lot of research for the current market and this is hands down the best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: You can't beat the price on this. I did a lot of research for the current market and this is hands down the best bang for the buck. I picked it up for my parents as a Christmas present and they love it. My mom loves to play her games on it and my dad uses it to stream to our chromecast. I've never had any issues with the device and it seems to be very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony K.

customer_reviews.title: I like this android device much better than the iPad although ...
customer_reviews.text: I have both an iPad and this android tablet. I like this android device much better than the iPad although it isn't nearly as fast. Most of my family have iPhones and travel a lot so I need the iPad for messaging and Facetime to communicate with them.
customer_reviews.author: Old Codger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest thing since sliced bread! I bought myself one for Christmas. It's extremely easy to use and is loaded with lots of pre-installed apps. There are hundreds more available. It goes where I go! I haven't learned to use all of it yet, but I will. It's fun to use!
customer_reviews.author: MaryLou White

customer_reviews.title: sound is ok but that is easily fixed with good headphones
customer_reviews.text: The battery life is decent, display rocks, sound is ok but that is easily fixed with good headphones. For the price, I LOVE this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Dezi

customer_reviews.title: Only thing I wish this would have is longer battery ...
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I wish this would have is longer battery life. I can get about 5 hours of use out of it before needing to charge. I even dimmed the screen and had it in power saving mode and no bluetooth connected. The 7" memo pad would last all day.
customer_reviews.author: another buyer

customer_reviews.title: I'm not that experienced with it but it has been reliable and the battery life seems to last a good amount of time
customer_reviews.text: Still learning all the bells and whistles. I'm not that experienced with it but it has been reliable and the battery life seems to last a good amount of time. Charge lasts about three days for me but when my daughter uses it, then the battery life is about six hours.
customer_reviews.author: T. K.

customer_reviews.title: Does what I needed it to do
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for what I want and that's a small tablet I can use to play workout videos while I do my long indoor cycling training during the Hot Phoenix Summer. Have 11 videos on it and still have lots more storage room left. Video is great, sound is great, touch screen works great. no Complaints or issues since I have had it.
customer_reviews.author: David Mello

customer_reviews.title: They were easy to set up and the kids LOVE them
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two of these tablets for my 9 and 13 yr old Grandsons. They were easy to set up and the kids LOVE them. The quality of the screen for gaming is very clear and performance is good. I'm very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: ckl

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with my ASUS MeMO Pad.
customer_reviews.text: I have two ASUS MeMO Pad 8 ME181C tablets that never freeze up like the 8" Dell and 8" Acer they replaced. The text, colors and light level are excellent even with a lower specification than the Dell and Acer or my older 2013 Nexus 7. I am pleased with the frequent software updates for tablet and apps that start and complete at a touch, three updates over the last three months.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Tablet
customer_reviews.text: The ASUS MeMo is great. It is very user friendly. I wish it came with more storage space as not all apps can be moved to the SD micro card. It is a great little tablet. It will lag a little when playing games, but not all the time. I still give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie L.

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the money
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for the money. Since I have an android phone, all my smart phone applications smoothly uploaded to the tablet. This tablet is not too big and not too small. I had considered getting a Memo Pad 7, but I'm glad I got the 8 inch version.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Garza

customer_reviews.title: I'm very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with its performance and price. I've have three other tablets and two of them were Samsung notes. I would say the performance is right up there.
customer_reviews.author: Kirtster

customer_reviews.title: But I can tell you it's light weight and works a lot faster and better than the old Pantech that it is replacing
customer_reviews.text: I use my tablet for simple internet use such as checking emails, personal calendar, social media, weather, etc. It is quick to respond for my needs. I don't use it for business, or for gaming, so you can say I have not really challenged the capabilities of my tablet. But I can tell you it's light weight and works a lot faster and better than the old Pantech that it is replacing, If your needs are similar to mine, you can purchase an Apple, LG, or Samsung at three time the cost, but why?
customer_reviews.author: J's junk

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this tablet. I've been through a lot of them (they don't do well around kids and drop on the floor a lot). As advertised. Battery lasts several hours, much better than some I've had. All in all, a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Fuglein

customer_reviews.title: the quad core processor is perfect for playing games
customer_reviews.text: This is my first tablet, and I did a lot of research before I chose to buy it. It works very well, the quad core processor is perfect for playing games, streaming movies, whatever you like. I am very happy with my choice. My son has a Samsung galaxy tab and to me the asus is much easier to operate, I prefer the asus user interface. Asus product work very well and last long, I would recommend it to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Vanetta

customer_reviews.title: negative experience
customer_reviews.text: 9 months of life he had, of which from the second month he is restarted, that if he could restart, because I was told that they could not change so my stay. and my tablet today died, disappointed my favorite brand, and poor service.
customer_reviews.author: jac_caballo

customer_reviews.title: A keeper!
customer_reviews.text: I waited to review so I could test drive the tablet for a few days. Amazing! I love it! It's lightweight, the screen is large and clear, the battery life is awesome, an over all great tablet. Very impressed and happy with purchase. *I've not tried out everything yet as it's my first tablet and I'm still learning but for my needs it seems very well suited. My niece and nephew played on it some too and I would say that it's very kid friendly. Compares favorably to similar tablets at a value price. Definitely a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha F.

customer_reviews.title: Purchased the device as our primary tablet for our vacation home and really love it. Have an iPad 2 as my main ...
customer_reviews.text: Can not beat the value. Purchased the device as our primary tablet for our vacation home and really love it. Have an iPad 2 as my main tablet for home but find the smaller size of the MeMo and performance perfect for streaming video, reading books, and surfing the web.
customer_reviews.author: Sbucch71

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced Brick
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is horrendous and the tablet slow as can be. Makes a great paperweight!
customer_reviews.author: J. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the price. 4 out 5
customer_reviews.text: The ASUS MeMO Pad 8 ME181C is overall a pretty good tablet for the price, it's really smooth, actually with some considerably numbers of apps installed in, has a standard quality sound, the screen it's very bright and it's helpful for reading comics, books and browsing in the web. It's a very light tablet, has a descent battery life and charge very fast.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Vargas

customer_reviews.title: Super Tablet
customer_reviews.text: Very nice tablet, quick with no glitgches. I like th Asus UI, no need to cutomize or change launchers, icons...etc. Good battery, very nce screen, expandabled memory. I bought this for my son but I like it better than my other kids ipad mini.
customer_reviews.author: Anton51

customer_reviews.title: arrived in perfect condition and its working wonderfully
customer_reviews.text: I order this one for me, arrived in perfect condition and its working wonderfully, no glitches, no slowdowns, light weight is just right for me and its doing what it was meant to do..one happy costumer :)
customer_reviews.author: G.S

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet at a great price! Runs faster than my old Asus transformer which is all I wanted. I've ran high graphic games on it and had several applications running at once, and have experienced little to no lag. I like that it is also smaller than my transformer. This size is perfect for me. Highly recommend to people who want a good tablet for playing around on, as I only use it for social media and games.
customer_reviews.author: mhs91588

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Unreservedly
customer_reviews.text: It performs as promised. I was most concerned about the screen resolution and dpi but honestly it looks amazing. A great price for a great product...what more can one ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn/Thomas

customer_reviews.title: I love this little tablet
customer_reviews.text: I love this little tablet. I use it for everything from book reading using the kindle app, to editing documents with the WPS app that you can download for free with the Intel free app package, to watching movies on Netflix. This is a great tablet for the money. The IPS display is beautiful, however it is a fingerprint magnet. The camera takes surprisingly good pictured for a tablet, especially when using HDR mode. I'd recommend this to anyone looking to buy a first tablet for a great price.
customer_reviews.author: EpicZeusTV

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is great! The resolution is awesome
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is great! The resolution is awesome, The sound quality is good and the apps load quickly. This is my first tablet and I'm loving it. The battery seems to drain quickly but I also do not have a comparison to another tablet. I would recommended this tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Great for 7 months
customer_reviews.text: Great for 7 months, then it died to never return. I tried all the troubleshooting suggestions but it is DEAD after 7 months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer (GS)

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tablet. i have had it for almost six months and have zero issues. the size is perfect, especially for reading. My apps all transfered easily and are compatible with the tablet. I am writing this review from a bluetooth keyboard that paired easily with the device. All of this for literally hundreds less than an ipad mini or similar.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Pott

customer_reviews.title: a great value, bought for my son for his 7th ...
customer_reviews.text: a great value, bought for my son for his 7th birthday, great games available and he loves it for youtube. great value for child or adult.
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: This tablet is awesome Great speakers Clear sharp picture Features some of my ...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet is awesome Great speakers Clear sharp picture Features some of my higher end tablet does not haveArrived sooner than expected
customer_reviews.author: Horsetreat

customer_reviews.title: Great 8" tablet!
customer_reviews.text: Great tablet for the price - my favorite of the three 8" form factor tablets that I currently own, handily bumping my ipad Mini, my previous favorite tab. High res screen, fast response, decent battery life and high quality fit and finish make this one hard to beat for someone looking for a capable "coffee table" or "on the" go tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Rodger Ram

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet for the price
customer_reviews.text: Love the new 8" screen. For the price this is a great Tablet. Asus has kept all the best features ie. memory expansion, great speakers, and high quality glass. I had the Nexus 7 and now use only the MeMo Pad 8.
customer_reviews.author: John Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: Fast, smooth and portable. Didn't miss the "lower" ...
customer_reviews.text: Fast, smooth and portable. Didn't miss the "lower" resolution. Most people won't IMO. This device represents an extreme value play in the 8" Intel-powered tablet space. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Berry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent deal. It's my first tablet
customer_reviews.text: Excellent deal. It's my first tablet, and just getting the hang of it. So far, the Asus MemoPad 8 has been a dream... the functionality and virtual keypad are user-friendly... even for a senior with failing eyesight.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis H. Noe

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Tablet
customer_reviews.text: The is a very good tablet. ASUS makes a very good tablet and the 8-inch screen is very good for reading, working on fins a word puzzles, etc. Thank you, ASUS and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Carr

customer_reviews.title: My wife is happy and that's =always= a good thing
customer_reviews.text: This was birthday present for my wife to replace her aging 1st Gen iPad. A few questions made it clear she would prefer Android to iPad and wanted a smaller unit. She loves it! So far it's been reliable and fast!
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: Good value and no complaints
customer_reviews.text: Bought an amazon warehouse deal with a small scratch on the screen. Good value and no complaints. Bright beautiful screen. Bought a 32gb card to go with it and I've been using this tablet every day for 4months and i love it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Excelente Compra!
customer_reviews.text: Hello, I finally came the tablet, yesterday I could try all day and works excellently, is very fluid passing eyelashes, the camera is very good. When reading is very comfortable, the truth is what I was looking for. In my country this model is not obtained, and I'm really happy. The package arrived in excellent condition. Strongly recommended purchase. Greetings and thanks.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Got a lemon and ASUS does not care.
customer_reviews.text: I loved it for two months. But then, after no rough or unusual use, the port somehow came loose so that the tablet could no longer be charged. I contacted ASUS and sent the tablet in to them, and I had purchased an accident protection and warranty plan, but they just sent a letter saying that a loose port was not covered and that they would repair it for $209. What a disappointment! I am disgusted with ASUS and with their poor customer care! I will certainly NOT buy their products again! I would encourage you to be cautious! If you happen to get a lemon, as I did, they will not stand by their products!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Super buy
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Well built and really like the Asus modifications to Android. Light weight and perfect screen size for a tablet. Great product at a low price.
customer_reviews.author: amazon shopping since 1997

customer_reviews.title: Not work
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Awful. I made the investment on a "good brand" like Asus, and the tablet just stop working (in the first month!!). In the workshop said that the problem was the "motherboard" and that it has no arrengement. I lost my money and no one gave me any solution. I think I will never buy anything in here, dissapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is the best tablet ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tablet ever. I love the feel of it when holding the back of the tablet it's doesn't slip out of your hand. The sound of the music and the speed of the apps when you click on them is fantastic. I'm glad I bought it. Need more colors and affordable 8-inch tablet covers available for the ASUS MemO Pad 8.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J.Buter

customer_reviews.title: Better out there
customer_reviews.text: Had alot of issues had to send to fixed & now asus won't allow you go store apps on Sd card.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: At the price, it's a steal.
customer_reviews.text: At the price, it's a steal. Just a little bit of lagging on wake. Not many extra stuff from ASUS - which is good. Have yet to see if there will be a good apps choice in the market, given this is Intel, not ARM. Especially, games.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great tablet! Enjoyable to own!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely a great tablet! Great when you get it and within a few days it gets updates that make it even better!!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Korte

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This appears to be a solid tablet. Had it for a few months now--used by my 8-year-old. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Susan G.

customer_reviews.title: This is a fine inexpensive tablet
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine inexpensive tablet. The operating system is not super sophisticated but seems fine and the screen looks great, speed is good.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Niterden

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves it and was able to use it ...
customer_reviews.text: My mom loves it and was able to use it without too much trouble, which is saying a lot considering she won't set her own alarm clock.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Cupkey

customer_reviews.title: This tablet lasted exactly 1 month and 2 weeks. ...
customer_reviews.text: This tablet lasted exactly 1 month and 2 weeks. Right outside warranty/return window before the display/monitor went black. I can see my data while charging on my computer however the screen is dark. I can't even access asus support. I work in tech and actually own a bunch of Asus laptop and motherboards but have never seen such an unreliable device.
customer_reviews.author: Kingsley E

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product! The person to whom I gave it for Christmas is very happy with it. It is responsive, the battery lasts for days, and the screen is sharp and clear. I may have to buy one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Pretty slick little pad
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a first venture into Android. Generally works well, there are occasional glitches with the standby/power.
customer_reviews.author: RSC

customer_reviews.title: ... for my 7 year old and it was an excellent buy. thinking about buying another one for myself
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tablet for my 7 year old and it was an excellent buy. thinking about buying another one for myself.
customer_reviews.author: george D

product_meta.description:
Color:Black| Style:Tablet Only

ASUS MEMO PAD 8 ME181C



THE ALL-NEW ANDROID TABLETS FROM ASUS
FEATURES:
 * Lightning Fast Quad-Core Performance
 * The Latest and Greatest Android 4.4 KitKat
 * Fashionably Thin, Incredibly Light
 * Full HD Video recording with 5MP Camera




THINNER.FASTER.SMARTER
FASHIONABLY THIN
Our thinnest and lightest MeMO Pads are perfect for your everyday lifefstyle

View Large 
INTEL POWERED PERFORMANCE
Tablets with lightning fast performance. Look for Intel Inside and move effortlessly between applications with a powerful quad-core Intel Atom Quad-Core processor.

AMAZING HD EXPERIENCE
Enjoy amazing entertainment anywhere with the clear and bright IPS Display with 170-degree wide viewing angles.

View Large ASUS HOMECLOUD
One destination to integrate your public and private cloud

 * Video and music streaming across cloud storage
 * Auto-upload photos from your device
 * Share with your entire family in ASUS HomeCloud

View Large MEET THE NEW ASUS ZEN UI
ZenUI is a brand new stylish interface complete with features that matter most. With the Color Theme feature you can pick the shade that best suits your personality.

WHAT’S NEXT
Your own personal assistant to help you to keep track and intelligently manage your schedule

SHARE LINK
Share anything at lightning fast speeds with any device without needing an internet connection Download speeds up to 32 Mb/s

 * In 1 minute transfer, 120 photos, 30 high quality songs, or 1 HD video




View Large 


CAMERA FOR EVERY OCCASION
ASUS smart camera features allow you to take the perfect picture and video chat

Time Rewind - Rewind your photos and never miss an important moment!

All Smile - Pick the perfect smile for each face so everyone always looks their best

Smart Remove - Tired of photobombs? Easily remove unwanted moving objects from your photos

Auto Selfie - Take high resolution selfies with the rear camera without worrying about missing a person



LOADED WITH VALUE
The ASUS MeMO Pad and Transformer Pad are loaded with over $270 worth of content and services

EMUSIC
Play, discover, and download music wherever your day takes you. 
Enjoy 75 complimentary music downloads from ASUS

ZINIO
Access 5000+ digital magazines from around the world Get 6 free Mini-Subscriptions to your favorite magazines and a $10 voucher at registration

ASUS WEBSTORAGE SERVIC
Access your data anytime, anywhere from any device. Get 500GB of online storage free for 2 years, that’s 100,000 photos or songs or 25 Blu-ray quality Movies

ASUS- TOP 3 GLOBAL CONSUMER NOTEBOOK BRAND
As the world’s top three consumer notebook brand and maker of the world’s best-selling motherboards, ASUS prides itself by making products that always “START with PEOPLE.” With a persistent approach to innovation, ASUS goes beyond satisfying current consumer needs to surpass expectations and spark the imaginations of people everywhere. ASUS designs and manufactures a diverse range of products as part of our relentless search for incredible, including motherboards, graphics cards, displays, desktop and all-in-one PCs, notebooks, netbooks, networking devices, servers, smartphones and tablets. Driven by innovation and committed to quality, ASUS won 4,256 awards in 2013 and recently received the recognition for the 2013 PC Magazine Reader’s Choice Award.

[1] Battery life will vary according to use. Battery life measured by looping 720P video, brightness at 100nits, external microphone, WLAN on and Gmail logged in for email and updates.
[2] Product Color availability varies upon regions and countries
[3] 1-Year North America Warranty included to provide you with the best service for a lower total cost of ownership. 
[4] Actual quantities of the images/videos/songs that can be stored in ASUS Webstorage will vary based on various factors, including file size or format.
